desc: a_n=a_{n-1}+2b_{n-1}, b_n=a_{n-1}+b_{n-1}, and c_n=a_n/b_n find lim_{n->infty} c_n
problem:
\begin{problem*}{}{}
  Let $a_0$ and $b_0$ be any two positive integers.
  Define $a_n$,
  $b_n$ for $n\ge 1$ using the relations
  \[
    a_n = a_{n-1}+2b_{n-1},\quad
    b_n=a_{n-1}+b_{n-1},
  \]
  and let
  $c_n=\frac{a_n}{b_n}$ for $n=0$, $1$, $2$, \dots.

  Prove that the limit $\lim_{n \to \infty} c_n$ exists and
  find the limit.
\end{problem*}
